name: (2-amino-3,5-dimethylphenyl)(phenyl)methanol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2762
Reason: 2-amino-3,5-dimethylphenyl and phenyl groups are known to increase the melting point due to their rigid structure and molecular weight. The presence of two phenyl groups can contribute to an increase of approximately +20°C each, totaling +40°C. The amino group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, which can raise the melting point by approximately +20°C. The methyl groups can also contribute to the melting point due to their molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +10°C each.
